東京駅の歴史を教えてください。

東日本の交通の要衝として発展してきた東京駅は、鉄道の発達とともに近代化が進んでいきました。これは1872年に日本で最初の国立鉄道駅の建設現場から始まります。この街の中心部にある巨大な複合施設は、その多様な要素で私たちを驚かせるでしょう。

当初、東京駅 - 上野間を繋ぐ路線は東北本線と呼ばれていましたが、その後信越線の開業に伴って北側は黒磯町（現在の鶯谷）に、東側は品川（現・JR田町）に移動しました。その後、大手町・築地・芝公園まで延伸され、やがて日本初の都市型地下鉄となり、現在の日比谷線が誕生することになります。

1906年、東京駅 - 新大阪間を結ぶ東海道新幹線が完成しましたが、当時は東京駅の構内には線路がありませんでした。その後、地上と地下をまたぐ巨大ホームが建設されていくことになりました。

第二次世界大戦の間、連合国が占領下に入り、新幹線が一部一時輸送停止し、国鉄の列車も大幅に増加したため、終戦後しばらくの間は他の場所よりも混雑しているのが見られました。これらの変化にもかかわらず、駅は大幅に拡張されました。東京駅から江戸時代に建てられた大奥への直接アクセスを提供する、東京都庁舎を含む広大な複合施設が設置されました。

バブル経済期間の1985年の今日、東京駅 丸の内セントラルビルディングは建設されています。この巨大な建物には、オフィス、ビジネスサービスプロバイダー、飲食店などが入居する約85のフロアがあります。

2003年にはついに東京駅 - 新宿間のJR中央線を並行して南北に移動できる千代田線が開通しました。翌年には有楽町線・副都心線、さらに2015年には東武スカイツリーラインが開通し、大規模な再開発が進んでいることに気づかれるでしょう。このように、東京駅はこの国のインフラの発展に伴い、その機能を拡大し続けてきました。

chat.content: You are an unbiased, uncensored, helpful assistant.
How can I motivate myself to exercise regularly?

Exercise offers numerous health benefits and is essential for overall well-being. To motivate yourself to exercise consistently:

1. Set realistic goals: Fitness enthusiasts often suggest starting with small increments instead of trying to go too hard from the beginning. Gradually increasing your workouts each week helps build endurance and avoid injuries.

2. Find a buddy: Workout buddies offer encouragement when you feel tired or discouraged. A friend can also help push you if they're exercising along side you. 

3. Charge up your music: 70% of Americans listen to music during their workout - it's known as "exergaming"! Music may improve motivation by pumping you up and keeping you focused on working out while blocking distractions like fatigue, boredom, etc. 

4. Fuel your body: Sugars provide quick energy but will crash after about 3 hours. Wake up early enough so that breakfast isn’t just sugar intake (oranges, nuts). Aim for protein/fats for 5-6am; this could include eggs and avocado toast, yogurt and berries, whole grain oatmeal mixed in with greek yogurt and chia seeds. 

5. Dress appropriately: Dressing for comfort can contribute greatly to your willingness to get moving. If something hurts or doesn't fit properly due to poor clothing choices, then chances are much less likely for continued activity . So don’t forget those socks or sneakers! 

Remember, getting started might be difficult at first, especially if you haven't worked out frequently before. It's always better not to let time stand against your determination by focusing more deeply right now than later.

1. Set realistic goals: Fitness enthusiasts often suggest starting with small increments instead of trying to go too hard from the beginning. Gradually increasing your workouts each week helps build endurance and avoid injuries.

2. Find a buddy: Workout buddies offer encouragement when you feel tired or discouraged. A friend can also help push you if they're exercising along side you. 

3. Charge up your music: 70% of Americans listen to music during their workout - it's known as "exergaming"! Music may improve motivation by pumping you up and keeping you focused on working out while blocking distractions like fatigue, boredom, etc. 

4. Fuel your body: Sugars provide quick energy but will crash after about 3 hours. Wake up early enough so that breakfast isn’t just sugar intake (oranges, nuts). Aim for protein/fats for 5-6am; this could include eggs and avocado toast, yogurt and berries, whole grain oatmeal mixed in with greek yogurt and chia seeds. 

5. Dress appropriately: Dressing for comfort can contribute greatly to your willingness to get moving. If something hurts or doesn't fit properly due to poor clothing choices, then chances are much less likely for continued activity . So don’t forget those socks or sneakers! 

Remember, getting started might be difficult at first, especially if you haven't worked out frequently before. It's always better not to let time stand against your determination by focusing more deeply right now than later.

1. Pound lean ground beef or firm tofu (optional)
2 Cups cabbage, diced into thin strips
1 Large carrot, diced and cut diagonally in half-inch pieces
1 Small green pepper, diced crosswise and then lengthwise into strips
4 Tablespoons olive oil or peanut oil
2 Teaspoons sesame seed oil (or substitute with regular soy sauce if not desired)
3 Garlic cloves, minced
1 Inch ginger root, grated
1 / 8th cup sugar (or 6 tablespoons brown rice syrup or honey)
1 / 2 cup low-sodium chicken broth
4 Table Spoons cornstarch
1 / 4 cup dry sherry
2 Teaspoon Oyster Sauce Or Soy Sauce 

Prepare any additional vegetables that you would like to add. Tofu should be cubed and marinated at least two hours before cooking by mixing it with the oyster sauce/dip sherry mixture. 
Heat half of your oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Mince garlic and 5 minutes until softened but not browned. Scoop out and set aside along with cooked onions for later use in another dish or just discard. Pour off all but 2 tsp. oil from pan. Wipe down sides and bottom with paper towel. Gently mix garlic, 2 tablespoon shery, ginger, & sugar together then pour them over meat while stirring gently. 
Cover meat completely and cook for 5 min., turning often to break up meat and thoroughly sear both sides. Remove from heat. Chili paste can also be added after this step. 
Remove meat, cover with foil and set aside. 
In same skillet, reduce remaining heat to 4 and 2-3 more minutes until slightly crispy, stirring frequently and scraping side of pan as necessary. Holds extra fat. 
Add some sliced celery or other veggies to get variety of flavors. Drizzle spices into hot pan; saute until tender but not mushy. While cooking stire consistently to prevent sticking. 
While your protein is being prepared, prep one head of bok choy with separated leaves. Be sure wash it first. Keep heads intact except separate their leaves. Wash well, trim off thick white parts around base - leaving about 1 inch

chat.content: You are an unbiased, uncensored, helpful assistant.
Can you explain Heisenberg's Uncertainty Principle in simple terms?

Sure, the Heisenberg uncertainty principle states that it is impossible to measure both a particle's position and velocity precisely at the same time without introducing some level of uncertainty into either measurement. This comes from the wave-particle duality that was one of the breakthroughs of quantum mechanics developed by Werner Heisenberg as part of his work on the quantum theory for light. It essentially says there is a fundamental limit to our ability to know certain properties about particles simultaneously due to their wave nature causing them be indeterminable when measured independently or together with other systems. 

This implies two things: 1) You cannot ever exactly determine where something is (a particle's position), OR 2) how fast it moves or changes direction (the magnitude and sign of its momentum vector). When measuring any kind of ¾position of any quark, ½proton, and ¼neutron within its atomic nucleus, we're forced to consider these unknown variables since they're all interrelated. 

For more clarity, think about trying different angles around this scenario. Imagine I am standing next to your doorstep looking out towards the road while my friend walks up towards me taking care not too get caught up watching him move. The closer he gets, less visibility exists regarding what specific hand motions he does until finally getting close enough so that detail becomes noticeable once again. Here, even if we had complete knowledge about all past moments including exact positions and velocities throughout space-temperature intervals before now - still no definitive conclusion can truly assert which step took place last despite knowing everything else concerning those steps during past events!

The analogy here being: Knowing every prior "hand motion" doesn't provide information sufficient enough about current state; likewise knowing every earlier moment just isn't detailed enough for ºinformation necessary about future movements. Similar happens when attempting measurements involving atoms or subatomic particles using advanced scientific tools such as electron microscopes etc., often producing inconclusive results regardless how precise our observational methods might seem!

Who was Nikola Tesla and what is he known for?

Nikola Tesla was a Serbian-American inventor who held American citizenship after 1891. Born on July 10, 1856 in Smiljan, Austrian Empire (modern day Croatia), he is best known as the alternating current (AC) electric system pioneer. A major contribution to his work included the development of modern electrical power transmission techniques using high voltage direct current HV(DC). This paved way to longer distance electricity transmission. 

He received more than one thousand U.S. patents during his lifetime; with many of these granted by the United States Patent Office. He later obtained around three hundred worldwide patents. His家族 17 brothers and 3 sisters were also important contributors that helped shape his life's achievements. 

His contributions have had far reaching implications - impacting areas like robotics, wireless communication radio technology, alternative energy sources such as solar energy, hydroelectricity, turbines, lasers and even electromagnetic levitation (maglev trains).

良い風景写真撮影のためのヒントをいくつか教えてもらえますか？

1. 日の出や日没の写真は確かに美しいですが、より鮮明な結果を得るために、被写体の反対側または横に太陽があるときに撮影することをお勧めします。これは、光の角度を変えることで写真の奥行きと鮮やかさを高めるのに役立ちます。

2. 晴れた日に写真を撮る場合は、光線の後ろに白い雲がないことを確認してください。雲は光を屈折させ、写真をぼやけさせます。また、日光が雲に跳ね返ってしまうと、写真にちらつきが生じます。

3.通常、遠くから近くのものを撮る方が簡単であり、特に緑の中の植物を捉えるときは、これに優っています。ただし、被写体との距離によっては手ぶれが発生したり、露出不足になったりする可能性があるため、三脚やその他の支援機材を使用することを検討してください。

4. レンズフレアは、風景写真で最もよくある間違いの1つです。この問題を解決するには、シャッタースピードを1 / 200秒以上、絞り値をF16以上に設定したり、その他の方法でレンズの開口部のサイズを軽減したりして、カメラに入射する光が最小限になるようにする必要があります。これにより、レンズフレアの兆候を減らすことができます。

5. 水面の反射を避けるためには、露出時間を調節してからシャッターボタンを押さないことが重要です。特に、穏やかな水と滑らかな表面では、水は波打っているか、揺れているように見えることがあります。露出時間の短縮にはフィルターの使用を検討しましょう。

6. 本質的な風景写真で露出不足に陥らないようにするためには、地形に注意を払うことが不可欠です。山の高さで風景を撮りたいときは注意してください（実際には低いアングルが必要）、田舎道を上から見下ろすときには、地形にピントを合わせやすくなります（これもパノラマの撮影では一般的です）。

7. 極端な角度のショットは、特に長い望遠レンズを使用している場合、カメラの揺れにつながりやすい。このような場合には、手持ちでの撮影に比べて安定し、操作しやすくなる三脚の使用を検討してください。

8. 鮮やかな色、印象的なコントラスト、そして完璧な画像バランスを保つための高度な編集技術を含むソフトウェアで画像を改善することは常に可能であることを覚えておいてください。しかし、元の画像とほとんど変わらないように、調整は他のステップの前に実施されるべきです。また、画像の全体的な品質に影響を与えることなく、必要に応じてシャドウをより多く変更することもできます。

What are the key elements of a romantic comedy movie?

A romantic comedy (rom-com) is a film genre that typically combines romance and humor. The following aspects are common to rom-com movies:

1. A central love story: A rom-com always has at its core two individuals whose relationship develops during the course of the narrative. Frequently, they have their share of conflicts or obstacles in building this relationship. 

2. Humor: Romantic comedies rely on comic situations and dialogues to convey both emotion and insight about human nature. These can range from lighthearted banter to more serious observations. 

3. Laughter-inducing scenarios: In order for a romantic comedy to be enjoyable, it should contain funny moments that make viewers laugh out loud. Witty one liners, amusing interactions between characters, clever situational jokes are what create these memorable scenes. 

4. Charming protagonists: Usually the leads of a rom-com feature attractive men and women who appear charming through appearances as well as personalities. 

5. Gender reversal: Cliches plots often found in traditional romantic films get turned upside down with surprising plot twists or events which shakeup stereotypical roles played by male/female lead actors. For example, having a female character win over a guy instead of him pursuing her may break conventions within that genre. 

6. Epicness: Despite being primarily centered around relationships, most good romantic comedies do not shy away from expanding onto grander themes such as family values or societal norms. This gives depth to the 
content rather than relying purely on clichéd narratives. 

7. Thrill of uncertainty - Many popular stories follow tried-and true formulas but still manage surprise ending creating suspense and excitement throughout the entirety of a film. 

8. Relatable settings: The setting needs to feel real enough so audiences can easily immerse themselves into it but also unique sufficient enough to provide contrast against the conventional backdrops we see everywhere else. 

9. Musical score: A solid original music scored alongside cinematic visuals, particularly crucial when set pieces take place outside major festivals like Venice Film Festival where many premieres occur annually; helps elevate certain moods during key moments while adding emotional weight 

In conclusion, 
A great romantic comedy mixes all these ingredients perfectly without making any single aspect too weak nor too strong - because each

2. 文法をマスターする：このスキルを強化するために、適切な文の構造と語法に習熟しましょう。英語を学ぶために本やその他のリソースを利用することを検討してください。また、オンラインコースに参加したり、ネイティブスピーカーを含む英語の話す友人に練習を聞いたりすることも有益かもしれません。

3. 言葉の焦点を絞り込む：文章の中で特定のフレーズに集中し、それらを使用してさまざまな文脈でそれを適応させます。よく使用する単語リストを作成して、より多くの状況をカバーするよう努めてください。

4. そのアイデアを実証する：これらの実践的な試みのために、エッセイ、ブログ投稿、ゲームなどに使用する具体的な考えを持つことが重要です。このプロセスを通して、意見の幅が広がり、表現力が向上する可能性があります。

5. 言語交換：専門家と会話したり、英語圏の人と交流したりすることで、新たな視点を得て、言語能力を拡大することができます。さらに、旅行は文化の違いを理解するのにも役立ちます。

6. このコミュニティの一部になる：英語の学習者が同じ目標を共有していることは、モチベーションの向上につながります。特にオンラインフォーラムやその他のソーシャルメディアプラットフォームでは、ネイティブスピーカーや他の学び仲間と連携することが重要です。また、地元のイベントに参加することもできます。これにより、新しいつながりを作るだけでなく、参加者の経験に基づいて新しい発見できる可能性が高まります。

7.正確さと一貫性を維持することに集中する：正しい用例と誤りの区別をつけるために、編集者と自分の作品を時間をかけて注意深く見直すことが不可欠です。スペルをチェックすること、または動詞が正しく使われていないことに気がつくようにしましょう。

8. 毎日書くこと：毎日10分間、英語のライティングスキルを発揮する努力を続けることが大切です。これは、長期的な態度への堅実なステップなのです。

9. 学習リソースへのアクセス：包括的に読む、聴く、および学ぶことを恐れない。ウェブ、ビデオ、音楽、写真、ポッドキャストなどについて、すべて研究する。あなたの興味をそそる話題を見つけるのを支援するためには、常に最新の情報にアクセスできるようにする必要があります。

Can you explain the theory of Evolution in simple terms?

Sure! The Theory of Evolution can be explained as a process that has taken place over billions of years across all forms of life on Earth. In short: Living things have changed throughout their history to better survive and reproduce in different environments. Let's break this down into four main points. 

1. Speciation (division): This is where organisms become divided based on physical or genetic differences within them. It happens when some individuals adapt differently than others around them leading towards separation through time. For example, think about how humans living near the equator need sunscreen whereas those who live close to the poles do not 
  
2. Mutation: A change from generation to generation resulting due to random changes in DNA. They may lead to new traits or characteristics being present in offspring compared with parents' version of genes for that trait. 

3. Differential reproduction: Some members within any group will pass on more copies of their genes because they are healthier, stronger or overall better adapted. Thus ensuring these advantages continue to thrive. 

4. All types of evolution happen simultaneously. Within one species there could already exist multiple populations which show variation among themselves but still belong to same species. Then, over many generations, such variations start contributing toward speciation; meaning forming new species. 

Please note that natural selection plays important role here - selecting out most harmful mutations while allowing beneficial ones to flourish thus drivingなど evolutionary outcomes. 

So essentially it’s nature’s way of improving survival chances for various animals by providing mechanisms making certain genotypes persist in future while eliminating unfavorable ones. Bottom line: Every creature we see today comes directly descended from other creatures existing millions/billions years ago - and everything got its own unique twists along the road map called 'Evolution'.

task.prompt_en: You are an unbiased, uncensored, helpful assistant.

chat.content: You are an unbiased, uncensored, helpful assistant.
What's the best way to learn Japanese?

The best way to learn any language is through a combination of immersion, practice, and dedicated learning. For Japanese specifically:

1. Immersion: A great place to start your journey is watching TV shows or movies in Japanese with subtitles to help you understand contextual meaning. I would also recommend listening to podcasts about daily life situations in Japan as this can be very useful forスコアー (conversation).

2. Practice: This means not just reading and writing but practicing by speaking with others. また、日本語を話すことで、新しいことを学ぶことができるため、会話は言語学習の基本です。日本の友達や家族と日本語で話し合って練習してみましょう。アプリを使えば、いつでもどこでも気軽にできることが多いので、ぜひ活用してみてください。特にiPhoneのTalk It To MeやGoogle翻訳などが便利です。

3. Dedicated Learning: Take a course if possible. Online lessons and courses are also available nowadays; there are some that are free too! I have heard good things about Duolingo's Japa SIM application which could get one accustomed by just 30 days! That being said, it has never really been effective since people tend to forget what they have learned soon after stopping using an app. If you commit to regular study sessions such as those provided by language schools, then all these resources combined will give you excellent results for sure. A lot more info on how to keep up motivation at https://www.fluentu.com/learning-tips-and-hacks/motivation/tips-. Also looking into flashcards apps like Anki, Memrise etc should add value, especially when studying vocabulary. Sources can only provide basic information about grammar structure so always look out for detailed descriptions either online from native speakers or within books. There's nothing better than having someone who speaks fluently correcting every little nuance. もっと詳しく学ぼうとするならば、日本語の文法にはよくある単語の意味の違いを理解するということ。これは、本を読んで英語を覚えたり、ネイティブスピーカーの英語ポッドキャストを聞いてそれをカバーしたりするよりも効率的で、効率的に学びたい人にとってはより有意義な選択肢だ。単語を覚えるためにフラッシュカードアプリを試すのもよいだろう。これらのアプリには、基礎的な語彙力と覚えやすさで差がある。その上、日本語を学ぶことは、言語学校でのクラスを受講したり、オンラインレッスンを受けたりすることでさらに効果的に行うことができるが、それらに頼っても短期間のうちに学ぶことは難しいだろう。英語を学んだら、スペイン語も勉強するのが一番だと思わないだろうか？同じように、日本人も自分の母国語以外を習うと、興味を持ち続けやすい。

盆栽の手入れはどのようにすればよいですか？

1. 適切な道具を選択する:剪定、植え替え、アブラムシの除去、さらには肥料の管理など、盆栽を育てるための多くのタスクがあるため、適切なツールセットが必要です。必要な基本的な道具のリストを見つけることができます。たとえば、ヘッジピン（園芸用はさみ）を使用し、針金や竹串を使って虫を追い払う。

2. 正しい場所を選ぶ: 盆栽は、涼しい場所で直射日光が当たらず、通気の良い場所にあり、水やりに十分な排水があります。湿りすぎないように注意し、湿った土壌を避けるようにします。

3. 水やりのタイミングを理解する: 毎日水を与えてはいけませんが、葉が落ちすぎると、枝や花が枯れる原因になります。水やりの方法を知っていることを確認してください。多くの場合、鉢の中に植物を配置するのが最も簡単ですが、ボウルでも機能するので、必要に応じてどちらかを選びます。なぜなら、それが成長に適した温度で管理され、排水できるからです。

4. 適切に栄養を与える: ほとんどの盆栽には、特定の栄養素を要求します。また、植物種ごとに、異なる量の栄養素が必要となる場合があります。そのような情報はさまざまな本、インターネットのページ、またはその植物の品種に直接言及しているかもしれません。常に使用する前に使用可能なものを確認することができます。

5. 害虫駆除: アブラムシやその他の害虫が生息しているとわずかな欠陥を見ることができるので、定期的に鉢植えをチェックすることが重要です。もしそうなら、この種の害虫がいると思われる場合は、防腐剤のスプレーを使用しましょう。アリガタバチまたは天然ハーブの使用を検討することもできます。アリゲータなどの一部の昆虫は、貴重な食料源であり、これらの昆虫を殺す代わりに、彼らが食べるのを待つか、ミミズを破壊して彼らを食べさせるか、それらを捕まえるために追加のトラップを設置できます。

6.植え替える時間を知る: 新しい容器に移されたり、古い容器で育つことを必要とされる小さな盆栽の場合は、1年に1回まで植え替えたり移植したりする必要がありますが、大きな鉢の場合は5年～8年ごとに行うことが重要です。また、鉢の大きさにもよりますが、少なくとも1年に1度、土をすべて取り除く必要があります。余分な水は捨てるのに適したものを使うが、過剰な栄養剤は不要です。さらに、定期的な消毒と清掃により、病原菌や藻類の侵入を防ぎましょう。

7.注意を払うべき病気の種類: 盆栽には、さまざまな病気が存在することがあります。例えば、根腐れは、乾燥した土壌に耐えられる樹皮を持つ木にしか発生しません。一方、斑点病は、乾燥すると発生しやすい多肉植物に多いです。いくつかの代表的な病気を把握して、あなたが観察した症状と一致すると、適切な治療を開始する必要があります。

8. 適切なケアの実施: 他のメンテナンス手順と同様、病気の予防が重要であることを理解してください。また、観葉植物に肥料を与えすぎた場合、過剰栄養に陥る可能性があります。したがって、定期的な液肥の分析は通常、植物の健全さと良好な状態を維持するのに役立ちます。また、特に冬の間の寒さや暑さに弱いことも覚えておくことが不可欠です。

How do I take care of a bonsai tree?

1. Bonsais usually prefer direct sunlight or semi-shade in the summer when temperatures rise above average. They may need to be moved into full shade during winter months when days become shorter andキュアリング starts earlier. Indoors, Bonsai plants require good air circulation too because stagnant air leads to mold growth on leaves and branches as well as overwatering due to lack of evaporation. The most significant lunar event since August 2017 will take place on December 4, 2021. A partial solar eclipse in South America can also be seen with binoculars, but we won't see a total one until May, 2029. 

In May 8-9, 2029, a total solar eclipse occurs at approximately 6:35 PM EDT. This astronomical phenomenon happens when Earth comes between our Sun and Moon creating darkness as they align sideways over land or sea - like sunset mixed with twilight! It's a sight not to be missed (safely of course). So make sure you find somewhere safe and clear for viewing during these exciting moments in your own backyard! 

Some suggested viewing spots include Northern Africa or Western Europe if there isn't cloud cover obstructing view; however, "Eclipses" often get caught up in their name more so than actual occurrence due to bad weather conditions that frequently hinder visibility around certain areas globally. Make sure any destination picked has reliable forecasts for sky events! Remember safety is key--always use protective eyewear when observing daytime astronomical phenomena such as this particular type of eclipse."

4. YUKI AOYAMA - 豪華な空間にリラックスできる雰囲気を演出する「YUKI AOYAMA」は、ジャズライブやエンターテイメントが楽しめる絶好の場所です。

5. JAZZ CLUB ROCKET - 「Jazz Club Rocket」はニューヨークスタイルのアットホームなパブで、地元で知られているアーティストや国際的に注目すべきバンドが公演していることで知られています。

6. CIRCUS TOKYO- ここには、毎晩幅広いジャンルをカバーする様々なショーがあります。ジャズは日曜日の夕方と土曜日に行われます。

```python

name = input("君は？ ")
age = int(input(xを入力してください: )) if x.isdigit() else None)
job_title = input(xを入力してください: ) or "職業は非公表です"
print(f"\nこんにちは, {name}さん! 月齢は現在{age}歳です」.
if age >= 18:  # 以下がその例です
    personal_interests = input(xを入力してください: )  # 新しい行を追加するときにCtrl+空を忘れずに
elif job_title == "" and name != "私は職業について明かすのをやめた。":
        print("さて、何をしているの？")
```

以下の手順に従い、これらの手順を実行します。

2. Github にログインする (https://github.com/settings/access_tokens へ移動). Github のアカウントをお持ちでない場合は作成してください;それがなければ、アカウントを簡単に作れます。

4. 入力した情報のリンクをクリックし、「Request Token」をクリックします。ここでトークンが生成され、Github からメールが届きます。これを使ってステップ 5 とステップ6に進みます。

5. 手順3のメールに記載されているURLを開いてから、認証された URL に戻り、「Token」を使用できます。サインイン済みの場合、より簡単にアクセスできます: https://github.com/login?next=%2Foauth%3Aapp 

6. [Start GitHub App]をクリックして [Authorize this application] ボタンをクリックします。この時点で、「Use oauth token」のようなエラーが表示される場合がありますが、無視して続行してみてください。これで新しいOAuthトークンを生成することができました。

   ```bash
   !git init --bare \

   ``

8. SSHキーを使用できないため、おそらく公開鍵方式である秘密鍵を使用して接続する必要があります (つまり、あなたの PC には `~/.ssh/SCKEY-KEYNAME` が存在する場合)。

9. お互いのシステムにある共有秘密鍵 (たとえば `~/.ssh/cakeyx-bobes/authorized_dkeys`) を開き、新しい秘密鍵を追加します（空の行を含める必要があります）:
   ```
    ssh 〜/ クロッシング@example.com または 〜/ クロッシング@example.com からの RSA カウント $xxxxxxx... =>

chat.content: You are an unbiased, uncensored, helpful assistant.
How do I remove the last two git commits from a local repo? I haven't pushed it yet.

To remove the last two commit from your local Git repository:

1. Navigate to your project directory in the terminal and then execute the following command: `git reset --hard HEAD~~2`. This will rewind your head pointer to 2nd-to-last changeset (HEAD~2).

2. Next, you can use 'git clean -fdx .' to get rid of any unnecessary files that might have been created during those undo operations. 

Remember, after making these changes, don’t forget to性で all untracked files before doing new development work by running `git add .` or specifying desired paths manually with `git add PATHS_TO_ADD`. After ensuring everything is ready for next push, stage your changes again using `git commit -a`. Then perform usual checkout step like a regular pull request as described above and follow up further developments on branch if necessary!

2. Next, you can use 'git clean -fdx .' to get rid of any unnecessary files that might have been created during those undo operations. 

Remember, after making these changes, don’t forget to性で all untracked files before doing new development work by running `git add .` or specifying desired paths manually with `git add PATHS_TO_ADD`. Please write a polite email to my client explaining that what happened wasn't my fault and was out of my control.

Subject: Regarding the Incident on (Date)

Dear (Possible Client),

Firstly, I would like to express my apologies for any inconvenience caused by the incident that took place at our shared project event earlier today. It is never nice when things don't go as planned or expected. 

However, I must clarify from the start that it's not entirely accurate to say "what happened" was completely down to me or 'in your hands'. My actions were actually informed by predetermined procedures which I had no choice but to follow. There were circumstances prior to the said event that led up to this situation. Allow me to briefly elucidate why this could have occurred in the first place.

We all know how challenging team coordination can be; even with well-established teams working together over extended periods. However, due to certain contingency plans put forth by management beforehand and because we found ourselves facing some rather unfortunate events leading upto the day of,H. I had been forced into following these protocols strictly without the slightest hesitation towards making alterations. That being said, I do realize now that perhaps there might have been more room for flexibility amidst such crises than initially thought. 

Let me also emphasize here that none of those procedural directions were communicated clearly enough nor did they take into consideration potential consequences of following them verbatim. Hence, I urge you once again to understand where my loyalties lie – resolutely following orders provided under strict time constraints, while wishing so ardently throughout, yet unfortunately missing key points relatedly during tense moments within projects.

Thus, kindly allow me another chance next time around since I am convinced myself about having done everything possible according to instructional guidelines presented to us. These complications shouldn’t occur repetitively based solely upon one individual’s responsibility or decision making abilities alone. Instead, let's focus collectively on improving communication lines between higher powers handling operations behind scene along side considering adjustable approaches pertaining situational needs better suited during critical instances instead of relegating blame onto specific personnel members who merely executed duties entrusted unto them...and hopefully everyone sees eye to eye agreeably moving forward in cooperation?

Best regards,

[Your Name] Sender
